description: Creates a new custom action that can be used in all pipelines associated with the Amazon Web Services account. Only used for custom actions.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the custom action, such as a build action or a test action.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as CodeDeploy.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version identifier of the custom action.

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: URLs that provide users information about this custom action. thirdPartyConfigurationUrl (string) --- The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service. entityUrlTemplate (string) --- The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for a CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline. executionUrlTemplate (string) --- The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action. revisionUrlTemplate (string) --- The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

nested_params.name: thirdPartyConfigurationUrl
nested_params.description: The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

nested_params.name: entityUrlTemplate
nested_params.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for a CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

nested_params.name: executionUrlTemplate
nested_params.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

nested_params.name: revisionUrlTemplate
nested_params.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

parameters.name: configurationProperties
parameters.description: The configuration properties for the custom action. (dict) --- Represents information about an action configuration property. The name of the action configuration property. Whether the configuration property is a required value. Whether the configuration property is a key. Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs. When updating a pipeline, passing * * * * * without changing any other values of the action preserves the previous value of the secret. queryable (boolean) --- Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret. If you create a pipeline with a custom action type, and that custom action contains a queryable property, the value for that configuration property is subject to other restrictions. The value must be less than or equal to twenty (20) characters. The value can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens. description (string) --- The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users. type (string) --- The type of the configuration property.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the action configuration property.

nested_params.name: required
nested_params.description: Whether the configuration property is a required value.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

nested_params.name: secret
nested_params.description: Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs. When updating a pipeline, passing * * * * * without changing any other values of the action preserves the previous value of the secret.

nested_params.name: queryable
nested_params.description: Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret. If you create a pipeline with a custom action type, and that custom action contains a queryable property, the value for that configuration property is subject to other restrictions. The value must be less than or equal to twenty (20) characters. The value can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

nested_params.name: description
nested_params.description: The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of the configuration property.

parameters.name: inputArtifactDetails
parameters.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID. The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type. The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_params.name: minimumCount
nested_params.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_params.name: maximumCount
nested_params.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

parameters.name: outputArtifactDetails
parameters.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID. The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type. The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_params.name: minimumCount
nested_params.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_params.name: maximumCount
nested_params.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags for the custom action. (dict) --- A tag is a key-value pair that is used to manage the resource. The tag's key. The tag's value.

nested_items.name: actionType
nested_items.description: Returns information about the details of an action type.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the action. Valid categories are limited to one of the following values.
Source.
Build.
Test.
Deploy.
Invoke.
Approval.
Compute.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the action being called. There are three valid values for the Owner field in the action category section within your pipeline structure: AWS, ThirdParty, and Custom. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The provider of the service being called by the action. Valid providers are determined by the action category. For example, an action in the Deploy category type might have a provider of CodeDeploy, which would be specified as CodeDeploy. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the action version.

nested_items.name: thirdPartyConfigurationUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

nested_items.name: entityUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for a CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

nested_items.name: executionUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

nested_items.name: revisionUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

nested_items.name: actionConfigurationProperties
nested_items.description: The configuration properties for the action type.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the action configuration property.

nested_items.name: required
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is a required value.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

nested_items.name: secret
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.

nested_items.name: queryable
nested_items.description: Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the configuration property.

nested_items.name: inputArtifactDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID.

nested_items.name: minimumCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: maximumCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: outputArtifactDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID.

nested_items.name: minimumCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: maximumCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: Specifies the tags applied to the custom action.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The tag's key.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The tag's value.
